channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Ascent and descent of Artinian module structures under flat base changes
item.description: arXiv:2507.19019v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $\varphi: R\rightarrow S$ be a flat local homomorphism between commutative Noetherian local rings. In this paper, the ascent and descent of Artinian module structures between $R$ and $S$ are investigated. For an Artinian $R$-module $A$, the structure of $A\otimes_RS$ is described. As an application, the Artinianess of certain local cohomology modules is clarified.
item.dc:creator: Tran Do Minh Chau, Le Thanh Nhan

item.title: Maps preserving the sum-to-difference ratio
item.description: arXiv:2507.18953v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: For a field $\mathbb{F}$, what are all functions $f \colon \mathbb{F} \rightarrow \mathbb{F}$ that satisfy the functional equation $f \left( (x+y)/(x-y) \right) = (f(x) + f(y))/(f(x) - f(y))$ for all $ x \neq y$ in $\mathbb{F}$? We solve this problem for the fields $\mathbb{Q}, \mathbb{R}$, and a class of its subfields that includes the real constructible numbers, the real algebraic numbers, and all quadratic number fields. We also solve it over the complex numbers and on any subfield of $\mathbb{R}$, if $f$ is continuous over the reals. The proofs involve a mix of algebra in all fields, analysis over the real line, and some topology in the complex plane.
item.dc:creator: Sunil Chebolu, Apoorva Khare, Anindya Sen

item.title: Magma-valued metric spaces
item.description: arXiv:2204.06838v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In the second section, we introduce dense unital magmas and show that a near-ring is dense if and only if it has a positive element smaller that unity. In the third section, we discuss magma-valued metric spaces. The density property of the ordered unital magmas and monoids helps us to generalize a couple of classical results related to the convergence and Cauchy property of sequences. The last section is devoted to magma-valued normed groups and some subgroups of the additive group of Cauchy sequences.
item.dc:creator: Peyman Nasehpour

item.title: On transfer homomorphisms in commutative rings with zero-divisors
item.description: arXiv:2502.09418v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We study the arithmetic of monoids of regular elements of commutative rings with zero-divisors. Our focus is on Krull rings and on some of their generalizations (such as weakly Krull rings and C-rings). We establish sufficient conditions for a subring $R$ of a Krull ring $D$ guaranteeing that the inclusion $R^{\bullet} \hookrightarrow D^{\bullet}$ of the respective monoids of regular elements is a transfer homomorphism. The arithmetic of the Krull monoid $D^{\bullet}$ is well studied and the existence of a transfer homomorphism implies that $R^{\bullet}$ and $D^{\bullet}$ share many arithmetic properties.
item.dc:creator: Aqsa Bashir, Mara Pompili

item.title: Higher Jacobian matrix of weighted homogeneous polynomials and derivation algebras
item.description: arXiv:2312.04677v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove that the ideal generated by the maximal minors of the higher-order Jacobian matrix of a weighted homogeneous polynomial is also weighted homogeneous. As an application, we give a partial answer to a conjecture concerning the non-existence of negative weight derivations on the higher Nash blowup local algebra of a hypersurface.
item.dc:creator: W\'agner Badilla-C\'espedes, Abel Castorena, Daniel Duarte
